--- title: One Website to Rule them All author: Emma Marshall date: last-modified description: | A brief explaination of why we made a new website and how it can help AP-LS provide more dynamic content to its membership. title-block-banner: ../../images/default-banner.svg --- ## Did AP-LS really need a new Website? ::: {.callout-note collapse="true"} ## Click to reveal
![](images/uh-yeah.gif){fig-alt="Person saying Uh, yeah" fig-align="center"}
::: ::: vspace ::: ::: grid ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6} ### SQUARESPACE速 made it easy to integrate sophisticated widgets and design... ::: {.callout-caution collapse="true"} ## BUT... - We paid for many advanced tools & features we never used/needed - The new features they developed and introduce were largely irrelevant to us -- i.e., did not target an academic or scientific audience - Allowed for embedding/hosting docs/resources, but provided few options for indexing dynamic content without python or advance js knowledge - No option for version control ::: ::: ::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6} ::: vspace2 ::: ::: vspace2 ::: ### ...and APA's site structure was well suited to serve AP-LS... ::: {.callout-caution collapse="true"} ## BUT... - We still lacked control over look/feel of the site - Slow response time made it difficult to add/remove dynamic content - Content sometimes lost in translation between web editor and APA web professionals - No option for version control ::: ::: ::: ## Welcome to the new `ap-ls.org`! This new [ap-ls.org website](https://ap-ls.netlify.app/) is built entirely in [RStudio](https://www.rstudio.com/) using [Quarto](https://quarto.org). ::: {.callout-note collapse="true"} ## What is Quarto速? [Quarto速](https://quarto.org) is an open-source scientific and technical publishing system built on Pandoc. - Designed with a scientific publishing audience in mind by Posit速 (formerly RStudio) - Makes it easy to incorporate reproducible content - Allows documents to be rendered in multiple formats including reports, presentations, websites or books in html, pdf, word, etc. - Includes features tailored to academic and scientific writing or resources - Makes it easy to do things like execute code in `r` or `python` or include citations, footnotes, scientific markdown, equations, citations, crossrefs, etc with minimal programming knowledge. ::: ## How this website works The site is published using [Netlify](https://www.netlify.com/). We are currently using the free version of Netlify but can upgrade to the paid alternative if we want more advanced features like password protected pages. ::: column-margin We also do not currently have google analytics or other tracking set up on the site. That can change if you want it to. ::: The content for the site is stored in the shared AP-LS Google Drive and the pages for the site are all stored on [GitHub](https://github.com). ### Making things easier - With git and version control we can spend less time maintaining a better record of what charges are made and when (and by whom). - By storing the content for our site in the shared `googledrive` we can streamline the process of making annual updates and also present more dynamic content on our pages. ::: {.panel-tabset .box-shadow} ## Example 1: Executive Committee ![Contact information for the 2022-2023 Executive Officers and Committee pages is now stored in a spreadsheet](images/leadership.png){fig-alt="Image of a spreadsheet will contact information" fig-align="center" width="472"} To update the new directory page for next year, you just have to create a duplicate spreadsheet and provide the updated url to the code block within the `leadership.qmd` or `committees.qmd` file. The information will be read into `r` and formatted for publication on the site: ![](images/listing.png){fig-align="center"} #### For additional information about how this workflow can be used to make interactive tables: see [Committees](../../about/committees.html) or [Conference schedule](../../conferences/schedule.html) ## Example 2: Pets! We can also use a similar process to collect and share content solicited from our membership. Take a look at the newly renovated [Pets of AP-LS](../pets/index.html) blog post page. This is a project of the Student Committee and is now set up to generate a new post whenever someone submits a new pet via the associated google form. When we receive a new pet, the data will be read into `r` and generate a new `index.qmd` template file with those details. ::: {.cell .column-page layout-ncol="2"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Here is the form](images/form.png){width=739} ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![... here is the yaml header that is automatically generated](images/yml.png){width=1293} ::: ::: Once we confirm and approve that the submission is legitimate, we can render the doc and add it to our site. ::: {.cell .column-page} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![... and here is a very cute pup](images/fitz.png){width=1015} ::: ::: #### For a less adorable example of a listing page: see [Grants & Awards](../../awards/index.html) :::
